discourse_list.title: [Rescheduled!] \xf0\x9f\x94\x8e Focus On # 12: Centrifuge Indenture Trust Agreement Deep Dive

content.content: Focus On # 12: Centrifuge Indenture Trust Agreement Deep Dive       For the 12th episode of Focus On, we will host a joint discussion by Centrifuge and the incubating Legal & Transaction Services Core Unit to explore the progress made regarding Centrifuge’s legal structure. This is an exciting update for the teams onboarding real-world assets. The Indenture Trust Agreement these teams have been developing is open source, reusable, and adaptable by anyone in the Maker Ecosystem. This agreement creates a pathway for Centrifuge, and potentially other RWAs, to build a sound foundation that scales the financing of RWAs. Eli Cohen @elidco - General Counsel of Centrifuge & Christian Petersen @christiancdpetersen from LTS will co-lead this discussion. The team will explore:  What is the goal of the agreement How the agreement works in practice How the structure will scale real-world assets for both Centrifuge and MakerDAO   Join us!  @juan and @retro will host.  When Time in your local-timezone format: 2022-06-28T15:00:00Z Mark it on your Google Calendar!  Where Crowdcast call   crowdcast    Focus On #12: Centrifuge Indenture Trust Agreement Deep Dive Register now for Focus On #12: Centrifuge Indenture Trust Agreement Deep Dive on crowdcast, scheduled to go live on June 28, 2022, 10:00 AM CDT.      Attn: @Recognized-Delegates, @GovAlpha-Core-Unit, @Risk-Core-Unit, @SES-Core-Unit, @Protocol-Engineering, @Growth-Core-Unit, @Oracles-Core-Unit, @gov-comms-core-unit, @collateral-core-unit, @dux-core-unit, @data-insights-cu, @immunefi-core-unit, @strat-fin-core-unit, @roollie

Focus On Call - Episode #12  July 18th, 2022  Agenda   00:00: Intro, Discussion and Questions with Christian Petersen and Eli Cohen.   Video https://youtu.be/JFmy0Oqbir8  For other episodes of FO, please check the forum.   Discussion  Christian Petersen & Eli Cohen 00:00  1914×924 146 KB   Questions 25:21 - ElPro: What are the trustee’s pre-default duties compared to a DST structure, and how will it protect MakerDAO? How would those pre-default duties differ from country to country? 28:23 - ElPro: The trustee acts for the benefit of MakerDAO, whose right to payment is based on a contract claim against the issuer. Is that right? Is there a scenario where the trustee will act in the best interest of the ten token holders? 29:48 - ElPro: How far away are Ricardian Contracts from being a reality, and what needs to happen for them to be admissible in a court of law?  Credits  Kunfu-po produced this summary. Everyone who spoke and presented on the call, listed in the headers.
Retro:  Update - We have rescheduled this session for THURSDAY 16-June at 15:00 UTC   The Google Calendar link has been updated, if you need to re-add this call to your calendar.

We’re excited to see any/everyone here. As MakerDAO thinks about institutional quality and investing responsibly into RWAs, a sound legal framework must accompany these off-chain assets as they come on-chain. This has been a work in progress for over 6 months and is huge step forwards for unlocking a large new market for MakerDAO through Centrifuge. There’s a quick glimpse into the importance of this framework from @Khan here:  twitter.com    Asad Khan @FinTech_Khan  Want to talk about the hard parts of bringing Real World Assets to DeFi? Well let's talk about off-chain legal structures then! @centrifuge has been hard at work with @MakerDAO to develop an open-source, protocol agnostic, and reusable framework for the community to use.   5:12 PM - 14 Jun 2022           92                22
Focus On #12 has been postponed again due to another illness. We will update this post when we are able to reschedule.
We’re back on for Tuesday 28-June at 15:00 UTC!
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
